moves.1... e6: boomshakalaka aproaches this game with a strange opening, not sure if trying to throw me off or if he has a gameplan
moves.2... c5 3. Bf4 h6 4. e3 g5: white contines with normal opening as black releases strange pawn formation - bishop retreats here
moves.5. Bg3 a6 6. Bd3 Bg7 7. Nbd2 cxd4: with more of a center threat this could of put a little pressure on white but as no imminent pressure all is ok
moves.9. Ne5: takes up postition he would normally like to develop to - lack of pawn support which needs to be addressed
moves.9... Bxe5: exchange taken white happy as plays pressure on blacks H rook
moves.10. Bxe5 Nf6 11. Ne4: pressure on the defending knight, at worse black loses a rook & pawn for a knight or...
moves.11... O-O: black feeling the pressure castles, with little pawn defence somewhat a foolish move and looses the game because of it
moves.12. Bxf6: only option here for black is 12.....Qa5,13.Qxg4,Qf4 - this would prolong blacks life with a queen exchange but leave black in all sorts of problems
moves.12... Qb6: black looks to gain a free pawn wuth a fork on d4 & b2
moves.13. Qxg4+: white puts queen into action against blacks weak defence
